questions.question: The child slept soundly.
questions.description: Here the verb slept has no object.

questions.question: The girl smiled sweetly.
questions.description: Here the verb smiled has no object.

questions.question: The lion caught the mouse in his paws.
questions.description: Here the verb caught has an object - the mouse.

questions.question: The bowler took two wickets.
questions.description: Here the verb took has an object - two wickets

questions.question: They took the child to the doctor.
questions.description: Here the verb took has an object - the child.

questions.question: I met her on a train.
questions.description: Here the verb met has an object - her.

questions.question: The clever girl solved the puzzle easily.
questions.description: Here the verb solved has an object - the puzzle.

questions.question: The driver stopped the car.
questions.description: Here the verb stopped has an object - the car.

questions.question: Suddenly the car stopped.
questions.description: Here the verb stopped has no object.

questions.question: Tears ran down her cheeks.
questions.description: Here the verb ran has no object.

questions.question: The cops chased the thief.
questions.description: Here the verb chased has an object - the thief.

questions.question: He admitted his mistake.
questions.description: Here the verb admitted has an object - his mistake.
